column4: Hello, I disabled everything in Compiz and now everything is screwed up. I saw a solution to default it, but I can't even open the terminal. Please help!
Alt + F2 matacity --replace
that doesnt work. I cant open the terminal either
using the mouse try creating a textfile
Tell me if you manage that
I just created a new file.txt
In the textfile (open it) and on line 1 type "metacity --replace" without quotes
done, what next?
save and close, then right click properties on the file
first before properties rename file to text.sh
then in properties find an option to make file exectutable
done
http://ma65p.files.wordpress.com/2008/07/screenshot-jre-1_5_0_12-linux-i586-copybin-properties.png?w=364&h=444
run the file by clicking
do I run it in terminal or what?
Just run it double click it
yea, but it gives me a box with several options
run in terminal, display or run
run
ahh. now I can move my windows but I still dont have the taskbar or start menu
terminal works now. Can I use the compiz default command?
which version of ubuntu
11.04 Will this solution work? http://www.ubuntugeek.com/ubuntu-tip-how-to-reset-compiz-settings-to-default-system-settings-from-command-line.html
Try if it doesn;t work click the text file
let me have a look
yes then run "compiz --replace"
After the gide I mean
If taksbar is not there after that run "" well I don't know the command for unity I use KDE someone help me out here
it didnt work. OmegaForte  I disabled everything in Compiz and now I dont have taskbar or start menu
run unity-shell
now I cant open the terminal again
run the textfile again
I did, but the unity-shell command did not work
it said invalid command
let me get back on you for the command
ok thanks
try running "unity"
I accidently had to reboot
Does it work now
no. I had to run the file again to move my windows
sudo apt-get install fusion-icon
what next?
run fusion-icon
OmegaForte: Where is the icon?
done?
The icon is in the system tray (don't know what gnome calls it
Like the xp taskbar part that gives balloon popups
Notification Area Thanks OmegaForte
Control + ALT + T
terminal should show
fusion-icon
now 75% of my screen is grey, nothing else happened
what do you think?
I have a solution unistall compiz get back to default then instal compiz and set up
actually OmegaForte 's suggestion
ok. How do we do this?
restart in failsafe mode
drop to root shell prompt
done?
hmm. how do I get into failsafe mode and root shell prompt? :/
at grub select recovery mode
isnt it just as easy to reinstall ubuntu at this point?
no its a simple fix
where do I find grub?
or in terminal ctrl ALT + T
type sudo apt-get purge compiz
you follow me
now the grey screen cover the text file and I cant get into terminal :(
CTRL + ALT + T, then sudo apt-get purge compiz
terminal doesnt work
when you boot ubuntu do you see a place labeled Ubuntu Linux XX kernel
tell me how to make that file so I can access terminal?
what do I do now? Things are only worse now

Reboot while pressing ESC. Then you will can an option Select ubuntu recovery mode, then select drop to root shell, the login, then type "apt-get purge compiz", then type "init 6" it will reboot, . everything should be fine, if it isn't run my textfile and it will work
i need to write that down. 2 sec
ok. I will try thart
that did not work. I did not get any options. it jsut booted
1 sec
one more chance and I am reinstalling this non user friendly system
Follow this then retry my steps http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/show-the-grub-menu-by-default-on-ubuntu/
fuck this. Im going to the xbox and reinstalling this crap when I get home
Its a simple problem actually, reinstall have patience, you will soon get used to ubuntu, we are all like that at fist
Please use proper language though

http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/ubuntu/show-the-grub-menu-by-default-on-ubuntu/

same 1st instructions but shift instead of ESC sorry my mistake

now ctrl + ALT + T metacity --replace
